title: The Irregulars: Roald Dahl and the British Spy Ring in Wartime Washington
description: Describes the covert intelligence operations of allied forces during World War II as experienced by wounded RAF pilot Roald Dahl, a patriot who used his charm and wits to infiltrate the upper reaches of Georgetown society and who worked with such figures as Churchill, Roosevelt, and spy chief William Stephenson to influence U.S. policy in favor of England. 150,000 first printing.
author: Jennet Conant
